53 namespace {
54 
55 
56 inline int my_max( int a, int b ) { return a > b ? a : b; }
57 
58 
59 std::string remove_quotes( const std::string& str )
60 {
61  if(str[0] != '\"')
62  return str;
63  return str.substr(1,str.size()-2);
64 }
65 
66 
67 std::string add_quotes( const std::string& str )
68 {
69  if(str[0] == '\"')
70  return str;
71  return "\"" + str + "\"";
72 }
73 
74 
75 } // end namespace

81 const bool CommandLineProcessor::output_all_front_matter_default_(false);
82 const bool CommandLineProcessor::output_show_line_prefix_default_(false);
83 const bool CommandLineProcessor::output_show_tab_count_default_(false);
84 const bool CommandLineProcessor::output_show_proc_rank_default_(false);
85 const int CommandLineProcessor::output_to_root_rank_only_default_(0);
86 const bool CommandLineProcessor::print_rcpnode_statistics_on_exit_default_(false);
87 const bool CommandLineProcessor::show_timer_summary_on_exit_default_(false);

90 CommandLineProcessor::CommandLineProcessor(
91  bool throwExceptions_in
92  ,bool recogniseAllOptions_in
93  ,bool addOutputSetupOptions_in
94  )
95  :throwExceptions_(throwExceptions_in)
96  ,recogniseAllOptions_(recogniseAllOptions_in)
97  ,addOutputSetupOptions_(addOutputSetupOptions_in)
98  ,output_all_front_matter_(output_all_front_matter_default_)
99  ,output_show_line_prefix_(output_show_line_prefix_default_)
100  ,output_show_tab_count_(output_show_tab_count_default_)
101  ,output_show_proc_rank_(output_show_proc_rank_default_)
102  ,output_to_root_rank_only_(output_to_root_rank_only_default_)
103  ,print_rcpnode_statistics_on_exit_(print_rcpnode_statistics_on_exit_default_)
104  ,show_timer_summary_on_exit_(show_timer_summary_on_exit_default_)
105  ,printed_timer_summary_(false)
106  ,added_extra_output_setup_options_(false)
107  ,in_add_extra_output_setup_options_(false)
108 {}

111 CommandLineProcessor::~CommandLineProcessor()
112 {
113  printFinalTimerSummary();
114 }

120 void CommandLineProcessor::setDocString( const char doc_string[] )
121 {
122  doc_string_ = doc_string;
123 }

125 
126 void CommandLineProcessor::setOption(
127  const char option_true[]
128  ,const char option_false[]
129  ,bool *option_val
130  ,const char documentation[]
131  )
132 {
133  add_extra_output_setup_options();
134  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(!(option_val!=NULL));
135  options_list_[std::string(option_true)]
136  = opt_val_val_t(OPT_BOOL_TRUE,any(option_val),false);
137  options_list_[std::string(option_false)]
138  = opt_val_val_t(OPT_BOOL_FALSE,any(option_val),false);
139  options_documentation_list_.push_back(
140  opt_doc_t(OPT_BOOL_TRUE, option_true, option_false,
141  std::string(documentation?documentation:""), any(option_val))
142  );
143 }
144 
145 
146 void CommandLineProcessor::setOption(
147  const char option_name[]
148  ,int *option_val
149  ,const char documentation[]
150  ,const bool required
151  )
152 {
153  add_extra_output_setup_options();
154  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(!(option_val!=NULL));
155  options_list_[std::string(option_name)]
156  = opt_val_val_t(OPT_INT,any(option_val),required);
157  options_documentation_list_.push_back(
158  opt_doc_t(OPT_INT, option_name, "", std::string(documentation?documentation:""),
159  any(option_val))
160  );
161 }

182 void CommandLineProcessor::setOption(
183  const char option_name[]
184  ,std::string *option_val
185  ,const char documentation[]
186  ,const bool required
187  )
188 {

191  options_list_[std::string(option_name)]
192  = opt_val_val_t(OPT_STRING,any(option_val),required);
193  options_documentation_list_.push_back(
194  opt_doc_t(OPT_STRING, option_name, "", std::string(documentation?documentation:""),
195  any(option_val))

199 
200 // Parse command line
201 
202 
203 CommandLineProcessor::EParseCommandLineReturn
204 CommandLineProcessor::parse(
205  int argc
206  ,char* argv[]
207  ,std::ostream *errout
208  ) const
209 {
210  add_extra_output_setup_options();
211  std::string opt_name;
212  std::string opt_val_str;
213  const std::string echo_cl_opt = "echo-command-line";
214  const std::string help_opt = "help";
215  const std::string pause_opt = "pause-for-debugging";
216  int procRank = GlobalMPISession::getRank();
217  for( int i = 1; i < argc; ++i ) {
218  bool gov_return = get_opt_val( argv[i], &opt_name, &opt_val_str );
219  if( !gov_return ) {
220  if(procRank == 0)
221  print_bad_opt(i,argv,errout);
222  if( recogniseAllOptions() )
223  return PARSE_UNRECOGNIZED_OPTION;
224  else {
225  continue;
226  }
227  }
228  if( opt_name == echo_cl_opt ) {
229  if(errout && procRank == 0) {
230  *errout << "\nEchoing the command-line:\n\n";
231  for( int j = 0; j < argc; ++j )
232  *errout << argv[j] << " ";
233  *errout << "\n\n";
234  }
235  continue;
236  }
237  if( opt_name == help_opt ) {
238  if(errout) printHelpMessage( argv[0], *errout );
239  return PARSE_HELP_PRINTED;
240  }
241  if( opt_name == pause_opt ) {
242  if(procRank == 0) {
243  std::cerr << "\nType 0 and press enter to continue : ";
244  int dummy_int = 0;
245  std::cin >> dummy_int;
246  }
247 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
248  MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
249 #endif
250  continue;
251  }
252  // Lookup the option (we had better find it!)
253  options_list_t::iterator itr = options_list_.find(opt_name);
254  if( itr == options_list_.end() ) {
255  if(procRank == 0)
256  print_bad_opt(i,argv,errout);
257  if( recogniseAllOptions() )
258  return PARSE_UNRECOGNIZED_OPTION;
259  else
260  continue;
261  }
262  // Changed access to second value of std::map to not use overloaded arrow operator,
263  // otherwise this code will not compile on Janus (HKT, 12/01/2003)
264  opt_val_val_t &opt_val_val = (*itr).second;
265  opt_val_val.was_read = true;
266  switch( opt_val_val.opt_type ) {
267  case OPT_BOOL_TRUE:
268  *(any_cast<bool*>(opt_val_val.opt_val)) = true;
269  break;
270  case OPT_BOOL_FALSE:
271  *(any_cast<bool*>(opt_val_val.opt_val)) = false;
272  break;
273  case OPT_INT:
274  *(any_cast<int*>(opt_val_val.opt_val)) = std::atoi(opt_val_str.c_str());
275  break;
276  case OPT_DOUBLE:
277  *(any_cast<double*>(opt_val_val.opt_val)) = std::atof(opt_val_str.c_str());
278  break;
279  case OPT_STRING:
280  *(any_cast<std::string*>(opt_val_val.opt_val)) = remove_quotes(opt_val_str);
281  break;
282  case OPT_ENUM_INT:
283  if( !set_enum_value( i, argv, opt_name, any_cast<int>(opt_val_val.opt_val),
284  remove_quotes(opt_val_str), errout ) )
285  {
286  return PARSE_UNRECOGNIZED_OPTION;
287  }
288  break;
289  default:
290  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(true); // Local programming error only
291  }
292  }
293  // Look for options that were required but were not set
294  for(
295  options_list_t::const_iterator itr = options_list_.begin();
296  itr != options_list_.end();
297  ++itr
298  )
299  {
300  const opt_val_val_t &opt_val_val = (*itr).second;
301  if( opt_val_val.required && !opt_val_val.was_read ) {
302  const std::string &opt_val_name = (*itr).first;
303 #define CLP_ERR_MSG \
304  "Error, the option --"<<opt_val_name<<" was required but was not set!"
305  if(errout)
306  *errout << std::endl << argv[0] << " : " << CLP_ERR_MSG << std::endl;
307  if( throwExceptions() ) {
308  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION( true, ParseError, CLP_ERR_MSG );
309  }
310  return PARSE_ERROR;
311 #undef CLP_ERR_MSG
312  }
313  }
314  // Set the options of a default stream exists and if we are asked to
315  RCP<FancyOStream>
316  defaultOut = VerboseObjectBase::getDefaultOStream();
317  if (defaultOut.get() && addOutputSetupOptions_) {
318  if (output_all_front_matter_ != output_all_front_matter_default_)
319  defaultOut->setShowAllFrontMatter(output_all_front_matter_);
320  if (output_show_line_prefix_ != output_show_line_prefix_default_)
321  defaultOut->setShowLinePrefix(output_show_line_prefix_);
322  if (output_show_tab_count_ != output_show_tab_count_default_)
323  defaultOut->setShowTabCount(output_show_tab_count_);
324  if (output_show_proc_rank_ != output_show_proc_rank_default_)
325  defaultOut->setShowProcRank(output_show_proc_rank_);
326  if (output_to_root_rank_only_ != output_to_root_rank_only_default_)
327  defaultOut->setOutputToRootOnly(output_to_root_rank_only_);
328  RCPNodeTracer::setPrintRCPNodeStatisticsOnExit(print_rcpnode_statistics_on_exit_);
329  }
330  return PARSE_SUCCESSFUL;
331 }
332 
333 
334 void CommandLineProcessor::printHelpMessage( const char program_name[],
335  std::ostream &out ) const
336 {
337  add_extra_output_setup_options();
338  int procRank = GlobalMPISession::getRank();
339  if (procRank == 0) {
340  using std::setw;
341  using std::endl;
342 
343  const int opt_type_w = 8;
344  const char spc_chars[] = " ";
345 
346  // Get the maximum length of an option name
347  int opt_name_w = 19; // For the 'pause-for-debugging' option
348  options_documentation_list_t::const_iterator itr;
349  for (
350  itr = options_documentation_list_.begin();
351  itr != options_documentation_list_.end();
352  ++itr
353  )
354  {
355  opt_name_w = my_max(opt_name_w,itr->opt_name.length());
356  if( itr->opt_type )
357  opt_name_w = my_max(opt_name_w,itr->opt_name_false.length());
358  }
359  opt_name_w += 2;
360 
361  // Some built-in options
362  out
363  << "Usage: " << program_name << " [options]\n"
364  << spc_chars << "options:\n"
365  << spc_chars
366  << "--"
367 #ifdef HAVE_STD_IOS_BASE_FMTFLAGS
368  << std::left << setw(opt_name_w) << "help"
369  << std::left << setw(opt_type_w) << " "
370 #else
371  << std::setiosflags(std::ios::left) << setw(opt_name_w) << "help"
372  << std::setiosflags(std::ios::left) << setw(opt_type_w) << " "
373 #endif
374  << "Prints this help message"
375  << std::endl
376  << spc_chars
377  << "--"
378 #ifdef HAVE_STD_IOS_BASE_FMTFLAGS
379  << std::left << setw(opt_name_w) << "pause-for-debugging"
380  << std::left << setw(opt_type_w) << " "
381 #else
382  << std::setiosflags(std::ios::left) << setw(opt_name_w) << "pause-for-debugging"
383  << std::setiosflags(std::ios::left) << setw(opt_type_w) << " "
384 #endif
385  << "Pauses for user input to allow attaching a debugger"
386  << std::endl
387  << spc_chars
388  << "--"
389 #ifdef HAVE_STD_IOS_BASE_FMTFLAGS
390  << std::left << setw(opt_name_w) << "echo-command-line"
391  << std::left << setw(opt_type_w) << " "
392 #else
393  << std::setiosflags(std::ios::left) << setw(opt_name_w) << "echo-command-line"
394  << std::setiosflags(std::ios::left) << setw(opt_type_w) << " "
395 #endif
396  << "Echo the command-line but continue as normal"
397  << std::endl;
398  for(
399  itr = options_documentation_list_.begin();
400  itr != options_documentation_list_.end();
401  ++itr )
402  {
403  // print top line with option name, type and short documentation string
404  out
405  << spc_chars
406  << "--"
407 #ifdef HAVE_STD_IOS_BASE_FMTFLAGS
408  << std::left << setw(opt_name_w) << itr->opt_name
409  << std::left << setw(opt_type_w) << opt_type_str(itr->opt_type)
410 #else
411  << std::setiosflags(std::ios::left) << setw(opt_name_w) << itr->opt_name
412  << std::setiosflags(std::ios::left) << setw(opt_type_w) << opt_type_str(itr->opt_type)
413 #endif
414  << ( itr->documentation.length() ? itr->documentation.c_str() : "No documentation" )
415  << std::endl;
416  // If an enumeration option then the next line is the value options
417  if( itr->opt_type == OPT_ENUM_INT ) {
418  out
419  << spc_chars
420  << " "
421  << setw(opt_name_w) << ""
422  << setw(opt_type_w) << "";
423  print_enum_opt_names( any_cast<int>(itr->default_val), out );
424  out
425  << std::endl;
426  }
427  // Now print the line that contains the default values
428  if( itr->opt_type == OPT_BOOL_TRUE ) {
429  out
430  << spc_chars
431  << "--"
432  << setw(opt_name_w) << itr->opt_name_false;
433  }
434  else {
435  out
436  << spc_chars
437  << " "
438  << setw(opt_name_w) << " ";
439  }
440  out
441  << setw(opt_type_w) << " "
442  << "(default: ";
443  switch( itr->opt_type ) {
444  case OPT_BOOL_TRUE:
445  out << "--" << ( (*(any_cast<bool*>(itr->default_val))) ?
446  itr->opt_name : itr->opt_name_false );
447  break;
448  case OPT_INT:
449  case OPT_DOUBLE:
450  case OPT_STRING:
451  case OPT_ENUM_INT:
452  out << "--" << itr->opt_name;
453  break;
454  default:
455  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(true); // Local programming error only
456  }
457  switch( itr->opt_type ) {
458  case OPT_BOOL_TRUE:
459  break;
460  case OPT_INT:
461  out << "=" << (*(any_cast<int*>(itr->default_val)));
462  break;
463  case OPT_DOUBLE:
464  out << "=" << (*(any_cast<double*>(itr->default_val)));
465  break;
466  case OPT_STRING:
467  out << "=" << add_quotes(*(any_cast<std::string*>(itr->default_val)));
468  break;
469  case OPT_ENUM_INT:
470  out << "=" << add_quotes(
471  enum_opt_default_val_name(itr->opt_name,any_cast<int>(itr->default_val),&out));
472  break;
473  default:
474  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(true); // Local programming error only
475  }
476  out << ")\n";
477  }
478  if(doc_string_.length()) {
479  out << "\nDETAILED DOCUMENTATION:\n\n" << doc_string_ << std::endl << std::endl;
480  }
481  if(throwExceptions_)
482  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION( true, HelpPrinted, "Help message was printed" );
483  }
484 }
485 
486 
487 void CommandLineProcessor::printFinalTimerSummary(
488  const Ptr<std::ostream> &out_inout
489  )
490 {
491  if (!printed_timer_summary_ && show_timer_summary_on_exit_) {
492  RCP<std::ostream> out;
493  if (nonnull(out_inout)) {
494  out = rcpFromPtr(out_inout);
495  }
496  else {
497  out = VerboseObjectBase::getDefaultOStream();
498  }
499  TimeMonitor::summarize(*out << "\n");
500  printed_timer_summary_ = true;
501  }
502 
503 }
504 
505 
506 // private
507 
508 
509 void CommandLineProcessor::add_extra_output_setup_options() const
510 {
511  if(
512  // Are we in this function already and calling it recursively?
513  in_add_extra_output_setup_options_
514  ||
515  // Have we already setup these options?
516  added_extra_output_setup_options_
517  ||
518  // Are we not supposed to setup these options?
519  !addOutputSetupOptions_
520  )
521  {
522  return; // If any of the above is true, we need to return right away!
523  }
524  // Set the commandline options for this ...
525  CommandLineProcessor
526  *clp = const_cast<CommandLineProcessor*>(this);
527  clp->in_add_extra_output_setup_options_ = true;
528  clp->setOption(
529  "output-all-front-matter","output-no-front-matter",&clp->output_all_front_matter_
530  ,"Set if all front matter is printed to the default FancyOStream or not"
531  );
532  clp->setOption(
533  "output-show-line-prefix","output-no-show-line-prefix",&clp->output_show_line_prefix_
534  ,"Set if the line prefix matter is printed to the default FancyOStream or not"
535  );
536  clp->setOption(
537  "output-show-tab-count","output-no-show-tab-count",&clp->output_show_tab_count_
538  ,"Set if the tab count is printed to the default FancyOStream or not"
539  );
540  clp->setOption(
541  "output-show-proc-rank","output-no-show-proc-rank",&clp->output_show_proc_rank_
542  ,"Set if the processor rank is printed to the default FancyOStream or not"
543  );
544  clp->setOption(
545  "output-to-root-rank-only",&clp->output_to_root_rank_only_
546  ,"Set which processor (the root) gets the output. If < 0, then all processors get output."
547  );
548  clp->setOption(
549  "print-rcpnode-statistics-on-exit", "no-print-rcpnode-statistics-on-exit",
550  &clp->print_rcpnode_statistics_on_exit_,
551  "Set if the RCPNode usage statistics will be printed on exit or not. Warning,"
552  " this prints to std::cerr or every process so do not turn this on for very large"
553  " parallel runs."
554  );
555  clp->setOption(
556  "show-timer-summary", "no-show-timer-sumary", &clp->show_timer_summary_on_exit_,
557  "If true, then Teuchos::TimeMonitor::summarize() is called in"
558  " CommandLineProcessor's destructor (usually at the end of main)."
559  );
560 
561  clp->added_extra_output_setup_options_ = true;
562  clp->in_add_extra_output_setup_options_ = false;
563 }
564 
565 
566 void CommandLineProcessor::setEnumOption(
567  const char enum_option_name[]
568  ,int *enum_option_val
569  ,const int num_enum_opt_values
570  ,const int enum_opt_values[]
571  ,const char* enum_opt_names[]
572  ,const char documentation[]
573  ,const bool required
574  )
575 {
576  add_extra_output_setup_options();
577 
578  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(enum_option_val==NULL);
579  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(num_enum_opt_values<=0);
580  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(enum_opt_values==NULL);
581  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(enum_opt_names==NULL);
582 
583  enum_opt_data_list_.push_back(
584  enum_opt_data_t(enum_option_val,num_enum_opt_values,enum_opt_values,enum_opt_names)
585  );
586  const int opt_id = enum_opt_data_list_.size()-1;
587  options_list_[std::string(enum_option_name)]
588  = opt_val_val_t(OPT_ENUM_INT,any(opt_id),required);
589  options_documentation_list_.push_back(
590  opt_doc_t(OPT_ENUM_INT,enum_option_name, "",
591  std::string(documentation?documentation:""), any(opt_id))
592  );
593 }
594 
595 
596 bool CommandLineProcessor::set_enum_value(
597  int argv_i
598  ,char* argv[]
599  ,const std::string &enum_opt_name
600  ,const int enum_id
601  ,const std::string &enum_str_val
602  ,std::ostream *errout
603  ) const
604 {
605  const enum_opt_data_t
606  &enum_opt_data = enum_opt_data_list_.at(enum_id);
607  std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator
608  itr_begin = enum_opt_data.enum_opt_names.begin(),
609  itr_end = enum_opt_data.enum_opt_names.end(),
610  itr = std::find( itr_begin, itr_end, enum_str_val );
611  if( itr == itr_end ) {
612  const int j = argv_i;
613 #define CLP_ERR_MSG \
614  "Error, the value \"" << enum_str_val << "\" for the " \
615  << j<<(j==1?"st":(j==2?"nd":(j==3?"rd":"th"))) << " option --" \
616  << enum_opt_name << " was not recognized (use --help)!"
617  if(errout)
618  *errout << std::endl << argv[0] << " : " << CLP_ERR_MSG << std::endl;
619  if( throwExceptions() ) {
620  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION( true, UnrecognizedOption, CLP_ERR_MSG );
621  }
622  else {
623  return false;
624  }
625 #undef CLP_ERR_MSG
626  }
627  const int enum_opt_val_index = itr - itr_begin;
628  *enum_opt_data.enum_option_val = enum_opt_data.enum_opt_values.at(enum_opt_val_index);
629  return true;
630 }
631 
632 
633 void CommandLineProcessor::print_enum_opt_names(
634  const int enum_id
635  ,std::ostream &out
636  ) const
637 {
638  const enum_opt_data_t
639  &enum_opt_data = enum_opt_data_list_.at(enum_id);
640  typedef std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator itr_t;
641  out << "Valid options:";
642  for(
643  itr_t itr = enum_opt_data.enum_opt_names.begin();
644  itr != enum_opt_data.enum_opt_names.end();
645  ++itr
646  )
647  {
648  if( itr != enum_opt_data.enum_opt_names.begin() ) out << ",";
649  out << " " << add_quotes(*itr);
650  }
651 }
652 
653 
654 std::string
655 CommandLineProcessor::enum_opt_default_val_name(
656  const std::string &enum_name
657  ,const int enum_id
658  ,std::ostream *errout
659  ) const
660 {
661  const enum_opt_data_t
662  &enum_opt_data = enum_opt_data_list_.at(enum_id);
663  return enum_opt_data.enum_opt_names.at(
664  find_enum_opt_index(
665  enum_name,*enum_opt_data.enum_option_val,enum_opt_data,errout
666  )
667  );
668 }
669 
670 
671 int CommandLineProcessor::find_enum_opt_index(
672  const std::string &enum_opt_name
673  ,const int opt_value
674  ,const enum_opt_data_t &enum_data
675  ,std::ostream *errout
676  ) const
677 {
678  std::vector<int>::const_iterator
679  itr_begin = enum_data.enum_opt_values.begin(),
680  itr_end = enum_data.enum_opt_values.end(),
681  itr = std::find( itr_begin, itr_end, opt_value );
682  if( itr == itr_end ) {
683 #define CLP_ERR_MSG \
684  ( recogniseAllOptions() ? "Error" : "Warning" ) \
685  << ", option --" << enum_opt_name << " was given an invalid " \
686  "initial option value of " << opt_value << "!"
687  if(errout)
688  *errout << CLP_ERR_MSG << std::endl;
689  if( throwExceptions() )
690  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION( true, std::invalid_argument, CLP_ERR_MSG );
691 #undef CLP_ERR_MSG
692  }
693  return itr - itr_begin;
694 }
695 
696 
697 bool CommandLineProcessor::get_opt_val(
698  const char str[]
699  ,std::string *opt_name
700  ,std::string *opt_val_str
701  ) const
702 {
703  const int len = std::strlen(str);
704  if( len < 3 )
705  return false; // Can't be an option with '--' followed by at least one char
706  if( str[0] != '-' || str[1] != '-' )
707  return false; // Not a recognised option
708  // Find the '='
709  int equ_i;
710  for( equ_i = 2; equ_i < len && str[equ_i] != '='; ++equ_i );
711  // Set opt_name
712  opt_name->assign( str + 2, equ_i-2 );
713  // Set opt_val_str
714  if( equ_i == len ) {
715  *opt_val_str = "";
716  }
717  else {
718  opt_val_str->assign( str + equ_i + 1, len - equ_i - 1 );
719  }
720  return true;
721 }
722 
723 void CommandLineProcessor::print_bad_opt(
724  int argv_i
725  ,char* argv[]
726  ,std::ostream *errout
727  ) const
728 {
729  const int j = argv_i;
730 #define CLP_ERR_MSG \
731  ( recogniseAllOptions() ? "Error" : "Warning" ) \
732  << ", the " << j<<(j==1?"st":(j==2?"nd":(j==3?"rd":"th"))) \
733  << " option \'" << argv[argv_i] << "\' was not recognized (use --help)!"
734  if(errout)
735  *errout << std::endl << argv[0] << " : " << CLP_ERR_MSG << std::endl;
736  if( recogniseAllOptions() && throwExceptions() )
737  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION( true, UnrecognizedOption, CLP_ERR_MSG );
738 #undef CLP_ERR_MSG
739 }
740 
741 
742 } // end namespace Teuchos
